qas.question: What is the Chinese name for the Yuan dynasty?
What is the Yuan dynasty's official name?
Who led the Mongolian Borjigin clan?
When did Khan formally declare the Yuan dynasty?
What is the Japanese name for the Yuan dynasty?
What is the Yuan dynasty's unofficial name?
Who rejected the Mongolian Borjigin clan?
When did Khan formally reject the Yuan dynasty?

context: The Yuan dynasty (Chinese: <a0_2>元朝<a0_2/>; pinyin: <a0_0><a0_1><b5_0>Yuán Cháo<b5_0/><a0_1/><a0_0/>), officially <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><b6_0>the Great Yuan<b6_0/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> (Chinese: 大元; pinyin: Dà Yuán; Mongolian: Yehe Yuan Ulus[a]), was the empire or ruling dynasty of China established by <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><b7_0>Kublai Khan<b7_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>, leader of the Mongolian Borjigin clan. Although the Mongols had ruled territories including today's North China for decades, it was not until <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><b9_0>1271<b9_0/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> that <b8_0>Kublai Khan<b8_0/> officially proclaimed the dynasty in the traditional Chinese style. His realm was, by this point, isolated from the other khanates and controlled most of present-day China and its surrounding areas, including modern Mongolia and Korea. It was the first foreign dynasty to rule all of China and lasted until 1368, after which its Genghisid rulers returned to their Mongolian homeland and continued to rule the Northern Yuan dynasty. Some of the Mongolian Emperors of the Yuan mastered the Chinese language, while others only used their native language (i.e. Mongolian) and the 'Phags-pa script.
